intro: Antiphylla grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered antiphylla, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces a milky sap that is toxic, a common trait among members of its family. Antiphylla grandiflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
